intro: Scleria mitis, commonly known as the softhead sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Scleria mitis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and birds.
